title: Experimental Flags
description: Validates experimental flags in world templates. Experiments that were enabled can affect world behavior even after being disabled.

fields.title: Experiment Active
fields.description: Warning when an experimental flag is or was enabled in the world. Some experiments permanently modify world data even after being turned off.
fields.howToUse: If the experimental feature is no longer needed, you can disable it in the world settings. Note that some experiments cannot be fully reverted. For publishing, create a new world without experiments enabled.
fields.technicalDescription: Data contains the name of the experimental flag

fields.title: Missing Level.dat
fields.description: Error when the world's level.dat file could not be found. The world may be corrupted or incomplete.
fields.howToUse: Ensure the world template includes a complete world folder with level.dat. If the file is missing, try re-exporting the world from Minecraft.
fields.technicalDescription: Data contains the expected level.dat path

fields.title: World Not Found
fields.description: Error when the world folder could not be located. Check that the world path is correct and accessible.
fields.howToUse: Verify the world template structure includes the correct world folder path. The world should be in a subfolder matching the manifest's world_template module entry.
fields.technicalDescription: Data contains the expected world path
